results.title: The Roman spring of Mrs. Stone
results.creator_credit: Jose Quintero, Louis De Rochemont and Seven Arts Productions
results.brief_description: Vivien Leigh stars as Karen Stone, a wealthy American actress who settles into a luxurious apartment in Rome after the sudden death of her husband and gradually falls prey to fortune hunters who seek monetary rewards in return for romantic favours. Warren Beatty plays her young lover who feigns amour then flutters away on another attractive assignment. Also stars Lotte Lenya. Adapted from the novel by Tennessee Williams.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jose Quintero, Louis De Rochemont and Seven Arts Productions

results.title: Track 29
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Rick McCallum and HandMade Films
results.brief_description: This surreal, darkly comic psychological thriller stars Theresa Russell as a young woman, permanently scarred by a teenage rape, which resulted in a pregnancy and the forced removal of her baby. Obsessed by the loss of her child, and married to an equally, but differently obsessed doctor husband, (model trains and playfully masochistic sessions with his nurse), she is confronted one day by a mysterious stranger who claims to be her long-lost son. It seems he also has been obsessed with finding his mother, but at this point reality and fantasy become confused and a deadly and erotic game begins … Also stars Gary Oldman and Christopher Lloyd with Sandra Bernhardt in a cameo role. Dennis Potter wrote the script.

results.title: Lenny
results.creator_credit: Bob Fosse, Marvin Worth, Martin Worth Productions and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Lenny Bruce, scrounging for laughs in the lowest dives, in a complex relationship with Honey, the sleazy stripper whom he married, and which dissolved into sordid self-destruction for both, was a folk hero of his time. Now saint, now sadist, now prophet, now punk, Lenny’s character was elusive, shaping itself into the form desired by the beholder. At times this film takes on the ‘cinema-verite’ style with interviews of major figures in Lenny’s life and flashback sequences to nightclub routines and events in the distant past. This tense, dynamic film fuses disparate time frames to produce an emotionally charged but never one-sided characterisation of Lenny Bruce. Dustin Hoffman and Valerie Perrine are excellent in their roles as the ill-fated Lenny and Honey.

results.title: Hairspray
results.creator_credit: John Waters, Rachel Talalay and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: The frenzied, all-out dancing, all rockin’ rememberance of Baltimore 1962. A time infested with glamour crazed teens to whom TV was everything. Featuring an electric combination of talents that include Divine, Sonny Bono and Debbie Harry, set around Baltimore’s coolest pop show, “The Corny Collins Show”. Happy teen viewers thrill to watching their towns’ coolest teens rock to the country’s trendiest new dances. One such viewer is Tracy Turnblad, a tubby teenager who lives her dream by getting her big shot on the show. However, Tracy finds herself in bitter competition with the show’s reigning teen queen, bitchy Amber Von Tussle. They battle not only for the crown but also for the true love of teen hunk, Link.

results.title: Legend
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Arnon Milchan and Legend Productions
results.brief_description: Legend is a fairytale produced on a grand scale, set in a timeless world peopled with fairies, elves, goblins, trolls and demons. It is the story of Jack (Tom Cruise), a young heroic peasant who takes his sweetheart, the beautiful princess Lili (Mia Sara), to see the most powerful creatures on earth, the last surviving unicorns. Unknown to the young lovers, Darkness (Satan) played to perfection by Tim Curry is using the innocence of Lili to set a trap to capture and destroy the creatures of light, the golden-horned unicorns. Children of all ages will be entranced by the magnificent make-up effects, from the smallest elves to the giant Darkness. The latter is unquestionably the most impressive depiction of Satan ever brought to the screen. It is a classic story of good and evil, love and hate.

results.title: Judgment at Nuremberg
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kramer and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This is an epic re-creation of the famous Nazi judicial trial, featuring an extraordinary international cast which includes Spencer Tracy, Richard Widmark, Marlene Dietrich, Judy Garland, Maximillian Schell, Montgomery Clift and Burt Lancaster. Capturing twelve Academy Award nominations including Best Picture, the film won Oscars for Best Actor (Schell) and Best Screenplay. In this stirring courtroom drama, acclaimed producer/director Stanely Kramer dared to ask one of the most emotionally charged questions of our century: who was responsible for the Holocaust? The story centres on the trial of four Nazi judges accused of war crimes, men who willingly distorted the law to perpetuate the greatest atrocity ever committed against humanity. Judgment at Nuremberg has galvanised audiences around the world with its poignant historical commentary, riveting entertainment and compelling performances.

results.title: The Sailor who fell from grace with the sea
results.creator_credit: Lewis John Carlino, Martin Poll, Sailor Company and Haworth Productions
results.brief_description: A disturbing adaption of the famous Japanese novel by Yukio Mishima. A troubled, impressionable boy’s idealistic attachment to his beautiful widowed mother is threatened when the perfection of that love is sullied by her love affair with an amiable sailor. He falls under the influence of a morbid young friend who is a member of a secret circle of sadistic schoolboys who follow a moral code that leads them to torture and dissect what they consider to be “imperfect.” Initially, they only inflict their bloody justice on animals but the “charges” against persons are mounting, and the shcoolboys code must be obeyed. Passionate love scenes and a bizzare ending highlight this unusual film, beautifully shot by Douglas Slocombe on English sea coast locations with music composed by John Mandel. Starring Sarah Miles, Kris Kristofferson, Jonathan Kahn, Margo Cunningham and Earl Rhodes.

results.title: Fritz the cat (E)
results.creator_credit: Ralph Bakshi, Steve Krantz and Fritz Productions for Aurica Finance Co
results.brief_description: The X-rated cartoon based on the characters from Robert Crumb’s comic strip became the animated world’s Portnoy’s Complaint, being the first animated feature in the history of motion pictures to contain nudity and four-letter words. Since its release, it has become an adult “classic” - a film everyone wants to see simply because it was naughty and often banned. In the 1960’s flower power era of sex, drugs and rock and roll, Fritz is the coolest cat in New York - poet, muso, dope-smoker and sex hound. In his East village apartment, he and his band engage in an orgy and are raided by the Police. He sets fire to his school, incites the local blacks to riot against white oppression and then leaves the Big Apple for the open road where he becomes ensnared by terrorist bikies! Features a rock musical especially written for the film and the voices of Skip Hinnant, Rosetta LeNoire, John McCurry and Phil Seuling.

results.title: The Music lovers
results.creator_credit: Ken Russell and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Russell’s controversial biography of Tchaikovsky (Richard Chamberlain) is a flamboyant and visually kinetic attempt to match the romanticism of the composer’s music. Though talented, charismatic and handsome, Tchaikovsky’s life was compromised by confusion over his homosexuality. The film traces his disastrous marriage to Nina (Glenda Jackson) and the platonic love he shared with his wealthy patron, Countess Von Meck, a woman whom he never met. “The Music Lovers” is a wildly extravagant film that defies the conservative cinematic traditions of classical biography. Russell was to continue developing his expressionist music biographies over the 1970’s and this film with its astounding cast and exquisite representation of pre-revolutionary Russia is a masterpiece. The music is conducted by Andre Previn and the script is by Melvyn Bragg, based on the book “Beloved Friend” by Catherine Drinker Bowen and Barbara Von Meck.

results.title: Tucker: the man and his dream
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Fred Fuchs, Fred Roos, Lucasfilm, Ltd. and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: This critically acclaimed but little seen film from Francis Coppola tells the story of Preston Tucker, who opened the door to the future in the 1940’s by building a revolutionary car that was called “The Car of tomorrow, today”. Jeff Bridges stars as family man Preston Tucker, who overcame extraordinary obstacles placed in his path by competitors and politicians, to realise his life’s dream, only to have it snatched away again. The film also features Martin Landau, Frederic Forrest, Dean Stockwell and a young Christian Slater. Original music by Carmine Coppola.
